title: Pork Chops with Sweet Curried Onions
instructions: Place the water and jam in a small bowl and stir to mix well.  Cut the onion in half and thinly slice it.  In a 12-inch nonstick skillet heat 1 tablespoon of oil over moderate heat until it’s hot but not smoking and cook the onion with the curry powder, stirring, until the onion is softened and translucent.  Stir the cooked onions into the mixture of water and jam and add salt and pepper to taste.

Pat the pork chops dry and season with salt and pepper.  In the same skillet heat the remaining ½ tablespoon of oil over moderately high heat until it’s hot but not smoking and sauté the pork chops until they are golden brown and cooked through, about 2 minutes on each side.
Add the curried onion to the pan and continue cooking, stirring, for about 1 more minute.
Yield:  Serves 2 to 4, depending on portions.
